intro: Talinum nocturnum, commonly known as nightshade talinum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly mucilaginous texture when crushed. Talinum nocturnum thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along forest edges.
